definition: to keep one's eyes open (idiom)/to be on one's guard/to be clear-eyed
to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish
bright/clear/resonant/to shine/to show/to reveal
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
eye/eyeball

sentences.english: Cleanse your eyes, so that you behold no man as different from yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 擦亮眼睛，不要以爲別人與自己不一樣。

sentences.english: Please have your eyes open to see the sunset sink.
sentences.chinese: 請擦亮眼睛，看夕陽的沉落。

sentences.english: More information should appear soon, keep your eyes open.
sentences.chinese: 更多信息應該很快就會出現，要擦亮眼睛。

sentences.english: But you have to wipe clean their eyes, carefully looking for.
sentences.chinese: 只是你要擦亮眼睛，細心尋找。

sentences.english: But there is subtle contact that you may need an even keener eye to catch.
sentences.chinese: 但某些細微的接觸，需要你擦亮眼睛認真觀察。

definition: to polish
to be taken advantage of
to comparison shop (idiom)/comparison shopping
to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
to easily trust/gullible/naïve
there is no such thing as a free lunch (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 shang4 bu4 hui4 diao4 xian4 bing3

definition: may I offer a bit of advice
think again and again before acting (idiom); consider carefully in advance
to see clearly/to recognize/to realize
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
penny wise and pound foolish (idiom)
hard to distinguish real from imitation
to cheat/to swindle
selective listening/to hear what one wants to hear
